think_procedure: The knob 'track_activities' in PostgreSQL is used to enable or disable tracking of user activities. We need to determine if this knob has special values that deviate from the natural order of numerical values. Typically, if a knob has a special value like -1 or 0 that significantly alters its behavior, it can be classified as a special knob. In this case, 'track_activities' does not have such special values; it is a standard numerical knob that can be set to 0 (disabled) or 1 (enabled). Since it does not have a unique special value that changes its fundamental operation, it is not classified as a special knob.
